Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Four line inscription. Made of green glass. Chipped at top.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Count Riamo d'Hulst
Curator's comments: This appears to be the only vessel stamp of Ṣāliḥ b. Qusṭanṭīn to have come to light so far. As on his weight stamps the legend, after the 'basmala' begins 'khutima', meaning 'was sealed' or 'stamped'.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (226)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ṣāliḥ b. Qusṭanṭīn
